TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit NoSettingsVersionUpgradeAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies that a settings provider should disable any logic that gets invoked when an application upgrade is detected. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To create a fully featured application settings provider that supports application versioning, the provider must implement the <xref:System.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsProvider> interface. One of the members in this interface, the <xref:System.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsProvider.Upgrade%2A> method, is called to notify the provider that a new version of the application has been installed. In response, the provider is expected to perform an appropriate action, typically migrating past application settings.
The <xref:System.Configuration.NoSettingsVersionUpgradeAttribute> informs the provider to suppress the upgrade logic associated with the current settings class. Therefore, the value of the previous version of this property group should not be migrated to the new installation.
> [!NOTE] > This attribute can only be applied to individual application settings properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the compiler-supplied default constructor for the <xref:System.Configuration.NoSettingsVersionUpgradeAttribute> class.
